body:
Looks like it's missing another condition here. If `rangeType` is enum, prefix MinRange/MaxRange-values with `$"[{rangeType.FullName}]::"`
https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/7dc4587014bfa22919c933607bf564f0ba53db2e/src/System.Management.Automation/engine/TypeMetadata.cs#L930-L945


```powershell
$m = New-Object System.Management.Automation.CommandMetaData (Get-Command Start-BitsTransfer)
$m.Parameters['Fails'].Attributes[1] 

    MinRange  MaxRange TypeId
    --------  -------- ------
Unrestricted Undefined System.Management.Automation.ValidateRangeAttribute

$m.Parameters['Fails'].Attributes[1].MaxRange.GetType()

IsPublic IsSerial Name                                     BaseType
-------- -------- ----                                     --------
True     True     ExecutionPolicy                          System.Enum
```

Using ValidateRange with enum should be discouraged in it's current state due to poor usability.

```powershell
# This parameter
[ValidateRange([Microsoft.PowerShell.ExecutionPolicy]::Unrestricted, [Microsoft.PowerShell.ExecutionPolicy]::AllSigned)]
[Microsoft.PowerShell.ExecutionPolicy]$UntypedBroken

# Will fail like this
> test -UntypedBroken Bypass    
test: Cannot validate argument on parameter 'UntypedBroken'. The Bypass argument is greater than the maximum allowed range of AllSigned. Supply an argument that is less than or equal to AllSigned and then try the command again.
```

Unfortunately the tabcomplete is alphabetically sorted, so they'd have to get all enum-values to figure out the allowed range
```powershell
> test -UntypedBroken       
AllSigned     Bypass        Default       RemoteSigned  Restricted    Undefined     Unrestricted

> [enum]::GetValues([Microsoft.PowerShell.ExecutionPolicy])
Unrestricted
RemoteSigned
AllSigned
Restricted
Restricted
Bypass
Undefined
```

ValidateSet at least shows the alliere values in the error.

```
test: Cannot validate argument on parameter 'UntypedBroken'. The argument "Bypass" does not belong to the set "Unrestricted,AllSigned" specified by the ValidateSet attribute. Supply an argument that is in the set and then try the command again.
```

Maybe the error message should be fixed in a separate issue and PR to be more clear when using enum ranges? And/Or fix tabcompletion to only show values in range

:tada:This issue was addressed in #17572, which has now been successfully released as `v7.3.0-preview.7`.:tada:

Handy links:
* [Release Notes](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases/tag/v7.3.0-preview.7)
